qfd_cmb packageÔÉÅ

QFD CMB Module - Photon-Photon Scattering Projection for CMB TT/TE/EE Spectra

This package provides tools for computing QFD-based CMB spectra using photon-photon scattering kernels in place of Thomson scattering.

qfd_cmb.oscillatory_psik(k, A=1.0, ns=0.96, rpsi=147.0, Aosc=0.55, sigma_osc=0.025)[source]ÔÉÅ

Compute oscillatory power spectrum P_œà(k) with tilt and Gaussian-damped cosine modulation.

This function calculates the photon-photon scattering power spectrum with oscillatory features that can affect CMB temperature and polarization spectra.

Parameters:

  • k (array_like) ‚Äì Wavenumber values in units of 1/Mpc

  • A (float, optional) ‚Äì Overall amplitude normalization (default: 1.0)

  • ns (float, optional) ‚Äì Spectral index for the power-law component (default: 0.96)

  • rpsi (float, optional) ‚Äì Oscillation scale in Mpc (default: 147.0)

  • Aosc (float, optional) ‚Äì Oscillation amplitude (default: 0.55)

  • sigma_osc (float, optional) ‚Äì Gaussian damping scale for oscillations (default: 0.025)

Returns:

Power spectrum values P_œà(k) at the input wavenumbers

Return type:

ndarray

Notes

The power spectrum is computed as: P_œà(k) = A * k^(ns-1) * [1 + Aosc * cos(k * rpsi) * exp(-(k * sigma_osc)^2)]^2

The squaring ensures positivity of the power spectrum.

qfd_cmb.gaussian_window_chi(chi, chi_star, sigma_chi)[source]ÔÉÅ

Compute normalized Gaussian window function in comoving distance.

Parameters:

  • chi (array_like) ‚Äì Comoving distance values in Mpc

  • chi_star (float) ‚Äì Central comoving distance for the Gaussian in Mpc

  • sigma_chi (float) ‚Äì Width parameter for the Gaussian in Mpc

Returns:

Normalized Gaussian window function values

Return type:

ndarray

Notes

The window function is L2-normalized: ‚à´ W¬≤(œá) dœá = 1

qfd_cmb.sin2_mueller_coeffs(mu)[source]ÔÉÅ

Compute Mueller matrix coefficients for sin¬≤(Œ∏) scattering kernel.

Parameters:

mu (array_like) ‚Äì Cosine of scattering angle, mu = cos(Œ∏)

Returns:

  • w_T (ndarray) ‚Äì Temperature (intensity) scattering weights

  • w_E (ndarray) ‚Äì Polarization (E-mode) scattering weights

Notes

For photon-photon scattering, the differential cross-section goes as sin¬≤(Œ∏), leading to scattering weights proportional to (1 - Œº¬≤).

qfd_cmb.te_correlation_phase(k, rpsi, ell, chi_star, sigma_phase=0.16, phi0=0.0)[source]ÔÉÅ

Compute scale-dependent TE correlation coefficient with oscillatory features.

Parameters:

  • k (float) ‚Äì Wavenumber in 1/Mpc (used as fallback if chi_star=0)

  • rpsi (float) ‚Äì Oscillation scale in Mpc

  • ell (array_like) ‚Äì Multipole values

  • chi_star (float) ‚Äì Comoving distance to last scattering in Mpc

  • sigma_phase (float, optional) ‚Äì Damping parameter for high-ell suppression (default: 0.16)

  • phi0 (float, optional) ‚Äì Phase offset in radians (default: 0.0)

Returns:

TE correlation coefficient œÅ_‚Ñì as function of multipole

Return type:

ndarray

Notes

The correlation coefficient includes oscillatory features that can lead to sign changes in the TE spectrum, mimicking observed CMB data features.

SubmodulesÔÉÅ

qfd_cmb.ppsi_models moduleÔÉÅ

Photon-photon scattering power spectrum models for CMB analysis.

This module provides functions for computing oscillatory power spectra that arise from photon-photon scattering effects in cosmology.

qfd_cmb.ppsi_models.oscillatory_psik(k, A=1.0, ns=0.96, rpsi=147.0, Aosc=0.55, sigma_osc=0.025)[source]ÔÉÅ

Compute oscillatory power spectrum P_œà(k) with tilt and Gaussian-damped cosine modulation.

This function calculates the photon-photon scattering power spectrum with oscillatory features that can affect CMB temperature and polarization spectra.

Parameters:

  • k (array_like) ‚Äì Wavenumber values in units of 1/Mpc

  • A (float, optional) ‚Äì Overall amplitude normalization (default: 1.0)

  • ns (float, optional) ‚Äì Spectral index for the power-law component (default: 0.96)

  • rpsi (float, optional) ‚Äì Oscillation scale in Mpc (default: 147.0)

  • Aosc (float, optional) ‚Äì Oscillation amplitude (default: 0.55)

  • sigma_osc (float, optional) ‚Äì Gaussian damping scale for oscillations (default: 0.025)

Returns:

Power spectrum values P_œà(k) at the input wavenumbers

Return type:

ndarray

Notes

The power spectrum is computed as: P_œà(k) = A * k^(ns-1) * [1 + Aosc * cos(k * rpsi) * exp(-(k * sigma_osc)^2)]^2

The squaring ensures positivity of the power spectrum.

qfd_cmb.visibility moduleÔÉÅ

Visibility and window functions for CMB analysis.

This module provides Gaussian visibility and window functions used in photon-photon scattering calculations for CMB temperature and polarization.

qfd_cmb.visibility.gaussian_visibility(eta, eta_star, sigma_eta)[source]ÔÉÅ

Compute normalized Gaussian visibility function g(Œ∑).

Parameters:

  • eta (array_like) ‚Äì Conformal time values

  • eta_star (float) ‚Äì Central conformal time for the Gaussian

  • sigma_eta (float) ‚Äì Width parameter for the Gaussian in conformal time

Returns:

Normalized Gaussian visibility function values

Return type:

ndarray

Notes

The visibility function is L2-normalized: ‚à´ g¬≤(Œ∑) dŒ∑ = 1

qfd_cmb.visibility.gaussian_window_chi(chi, chi_star, sigma_chi)[source]ÔÉÅ

Compute normalized Gaussian window function in comoving distance.

Parameters:

  • chi (array_like) ‚Äì Comoving distance values in Mpc

  • chi_star (float) ‚Äì Central comoving distance for the Gaussian in Mpc

  • sigma_chi (float) ‚Äì Width parameter for the Gaussian in Mpc

Returns:

Normalized Gaussian window function values

Return type:

ndarray

Notes

The window function is L2-normalized: ‚à´ W¬≤(œá) dœá = 1

qfd_cmb.kernels moduleÔÉÅ

Scattering kernels and correlation functions for photon-photon interactions.

This module provides the Mueller matrix coefficients and correlation functions needed for computing CMB temperature and polarization spectra with photon-photon scattering effects.

qfd_cmb.kernels.sin2_mueller_coeffs(mu)[source]ÔÉÅ

Compute Mueller matrix coefficients for sin¬≤(Œ∏) scattering kernel.

Parameters:

mu (array_like) ‚Äì Cosine of scattering angle, mu = cos(Œ∏)

Returns:

  • w_T (ndarray) ‚Äì Temperature (intensity) scattering weights

  • w_E (ndarray) ‚Äì Polarization (E-mode) scattering weights

Notes

For photon-photon scattering, the differential cross-section goes as sin¬≤(Œ∏), leading to scattering weights proportional to (1 - Œº¬≤).

qfd_cmb.kernels.te_correlation_phase(k, rpsi, ell, chi_star, sigma_phase=0.16, phi0=0.0)[source]ÔÉÅ

Compute scale-dependent TE correlation coefficient with oscillatory features.

Parameters:

  • k (float) ‚Äì Wavenumber in 1/Mpc (used as fallback if chi_star=0)

  • rpsi (float) ‚Äì Oscillation scale in Mpc

  • ell (array_like) ‚Äì Multipole values

  • chi_star (float) ‚Äì Comoving distance to last scattering in Mpc

  • sigma_phase (float, optional) ‚Äì Damping parameter for high-ell suppression (default: 0.16)

  • phi0 (float, optional) ‚Äì Phase offset in radians (default: 0.0)

Returns:

TE correlation coefficient œÅ_‚Ñì as function of multipole

Return type:

ndarray

Notes

The correlation coefficient includes oscillatory features that can lead to sign changes in the TE spectrum, mimicking observed CMB data features.
